title: Sure, here's a reading list of 20 articles on instruction following using large language models (LLMs) up to 2023
**"Language Models are Few-Shot Learners"**
**"GPT-3: Language Models are Few-Shot Learners"**
**"T5: Exploring the Limits of Transfer Learning with a Unified Text-to-Text Transformer"**
Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding"** - Devlin et al
**"Instruction Tuning: Improving Zero-Shot Learning by Explicitly Tuning to Instructions"**
Few-Shot Learning with Instruction-Finetuned Language Models"** - Wei et al
**"Prompt Programming for Large Language Models: Beyond the Few-Shot Paradigm"**
**"InstructGPT: Training Language Models to Follow Instructions with Human Feedback"**
**"Aligning Language Models to Follow Instructions"** - Bai et al
**"The Power of Scale for Parameter-Efficient Prompt Tuning"** - Lester et al
**"Learning to Summarize with Human Feedback"** - Stiennon et al
**"Self-Supervised Learning of Language Models with Instruction-based Data Augmentation"** - Wang et al
**"Improving Language Models by Retraining on Their Own Feedback"**
**"Prompt-Based Learning for Natural Language Processing: A Survey"**
**"Multitask Prompted Training Enables Zero-Shot Task Generalization"** - Sanh et al
**"Scaling Instruction-Finetuned Language Models"** - Mishra et al
**"Language Models as Knowledge Bases?"** - Petroni et al
**"Language Models as Zero-Shot Planners: Extracting Actionable Knowledge for Embodied Agents"**
**"Chain of Thought Prompting Elicits Reasoning in Large Language Models"**
**"Evaluating Large Language Models Trained on Code"** - Chen et al
These articles cover a range of topics related to instruction following, prompt engineering, and the capabilities of large language models in various contexts
